intro: Parosela elata, commonly known as the tall parosela, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it blooms during the spring and summer months. Parosela elata is a relatively rare species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
